sen.j: 南進論（なんしんろん）とは、日本が南方地域へ進出すべきであるという第二次世界大戦前の対外論である。
sen.e: The Nanshinron (southward advance) theory was one of Japan's foreign policies before World War II, advocating that the country should advance into Southeast Asia and the South Pacific islands.
The Nanshinron (southward advance) theory was one of Japan's foreign policies before World War II, advocating that the country should advance into Southeast Asia and the South Pacific islands.
The Nanshinron (southward advance) theory was one of Japan's foreign policies before World War II, advocating that the country should advance into Southeast Asia and the South Pacific islands.

sen.j: 古くは明治時代から提唱された。
sen.e: Nanshinron was first advocated during the Meiji period.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Nanshinron was first advocated during the Meiji period.
Nanshinron was first advocated during the Meiji period.

sen.j: 台湾領有や第一次世界大戦後の南洋諸島の委任統治の際にも論じられた。
sen.e: It was discussed in relation to Japan's colonial rule of Taiwan and her mandate over the Pacific islands after World War I.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It was discussed in relation to Japan's colonial rule of Taiwan and her mandate over the Pacific islands after World War I.
It was discussed in relation to Japan's colonial rule of Taiwan and her mandate over the Pacific islands after World War I.

sen.j: 特に日中戦争の頃に主唱された。
sen.e: It was vigorously advocated especially during the Sino-Japanese War.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It was vigorously advocated especially during the Sino-Japanese War.
It was vigorously advocated especially during the Sino-Japanese War.

sen.j: 初期の南進論は必ずしも日本による領土拡張や軍事的進出と結びついたものではなかった。
sen.e: It was not necessarily linked to Japan's territorial expansion and military advance in the Meiji period.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It was not necessarily linked to Japan's territorial expansion and military advance in the Meiji period.
It was not necessarily linked to Japan's territorial expansion and military advance in the Meiji period.

sen.j: 1930年代以降、日本における「自存自衛」理念と結びついた。
sen.e: After the 1930s it was associated with an idea of 'Self-sufficiency and Self-defence' in Japan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: After the 1930s it was associated with an idea of 'Self-sufficiency and Self-defence' in Japan.
After the 1930s it was associated with an idea of 'Self-sufficiency and Self-defence' in Japan.

sen.j: 「武力による南進」が志向されるようになった。
sen.e: It was geared into 'the southward advance of Japanese armies.'
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It was geared into 'the southward advance of Japanese armies.'
It was geared into 'the southward advance of Japanese armies.'

sen.j: 「北守南進論」とも称される。
sen.e: It is also called 'the Hokushu Nanshin (defend the north and advance to the south) policy.'
It is also called 'the Hokushu Nanshin (defend the north and advance to the south) policy.'
It is also called 'the Hokushu Nanshin (defend the north and advance to the south) policy.'

tit.j: 明治・大正期の南進論
tit.e: Nanshinron in the Meiji and the Taisho Period
Nanshinron in the Meiji and the Taisho Period
Nanshinron in the Meiji and the Taisho Period

sen.j: 南進論は田口卯吉・志賀重昂・菅沼貞風などの民間の論客が提唱したもの。
sen.e: The Nanshinron theory was advocated by some civilian critics such as Ukitchi TAGUCHI, Shigetaka SHIGA and Sadakaze SUGANUMA.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The Nanshinron theory was advocated by some civilian critics such as Ukitchi TAGUCHI, Shigetaka SHIGA and Sadakaze SUGANUMA.
The Nanshinron theory was advocated by some civilian critics such as Ukitchi TAGUCHI, Shigetaka SHIGA and Sadakaze SUGANUMA.

sen.j: 自由貿易の流れを汲むものとアジア主義の流れを汲むものに大別される。
sen.e: It was roughly divided into two: one branch deriving from free trade and the other from Asianism.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It was roughly divided into two: one branch deriving from free trade and the other from Asianism.
It was roughly divided into two: one branch deriving from free trade and the other from Asianism.

sen.j: 彼らはオセアニアや東南アジア島嶼部への貿易・移民事業を試みた。
sen.e: The critics attempted trade with and immigration to islands in Oceania and Southeast Asia.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The critics attempted trade with and immigration to islands in Oceania and Southeast Asia.
The critics attempted trade with and immigration to islands in Oceania and Southeast Asia.

sen.j: 日清戦争中の南進論は台湾領有の具体的主張であった。
sen.e: Nanshinron during the Sino-Japanese War was a concrete claim over Japan's colonial rule of Taiwan.
Nanshinron during the Sino-Japanese War was a concrete claim over Japan's colonial rule of Taiwan.
Nanshinron during the Sino-Japanese War was a concrete claim over Japan's colonial rule of Taiwan.

sen.j: 日清戦争・日露戦争以降、日本の国策の基本は朝鮮・満州・中国大陸など東北アジアへの進出を図る北進論となった。
sen.e: After the Wars with China and Russia, Japan's basic national policy became 'Hokushinron,' advance into Northeast Asia, including Korea, Manchuria and mainland China.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: After the Wars with China and Russia, Japan's basic national policy became 'Hokushinron,' advance into Northeast Asia, including Korea, Manchuria and mainland China.
After the Wars with China and Russia, Japan's basic national policy became 'Hokushinron,' advance into Northeast Asia, including Korea, Manchuria and mainland China.

sen.j: そのため南進論は民間・非主流派の対外政策論にとどまった。
sen.e: Nanshinron therefore remained as a non-governmental and non-mainstream foreign policy.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Nanshinron therefore remained as a non-governmental and non-mainstream foreign policy.
Nanshinron therefore remained as a non-governmental and non-mainstream foreign policy.

sen.j: （日清戦後のフィリピン独立革命（1898年）の際、日本軍が独立派を支援することでこの地に勢力を扶植することが模索された。
sen.e: (When the Philippine Revolution took place after the Sino-Japanese War (in 1898), efforts were made for the Imperial Japanese Navy to support the revolutionaries in order to secure Japan's influence there.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: (When the Philippine Revolution took place after the Sino-Japanese War (in 1898), efforts were made for the Imperial Japanese Navy to support the revolutionaries in order to secure Japan's influence there.

(When the Philippine Revolution took place after the Sino-Japanese War (in 1898), efforts were made for the Imperial Japanese Navy to support the revolutionaries in order to secure Japan's influence there.

sen.j: だが、結局は断念された）。
sen.e: However, this was abandoned).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, this was abandoned).
However, this was abandoned).

sen.j: 1914年第一次世界大戦参加にともない、大日本帝国海軍がドイツ領ミクロネシア（南洋群島）を占領した。
sen.e: When Japan took part in World War I in 1914, the Imperial Japanese Navy conquered German Micronesia (South Pacific islands).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: When Japan took part in World War I in 1914, the Imperial Japanese Navy conquered German Micronesia (South Pacific islands).
When Japan took part in World War I in 1914, the Imperial Japanese Navy conquered German Micronesia (South Pacific islands).

sen.j: 戦後この地が日本の委任統治として事実上の植民地になった。
sen.e: After the war the islands practically became Japan's colony as her mandate.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: After the war the islands practically became Japan's colony as her mandate.
After the war the islands practically became Japan's colony as her mandate.

sen.j: 南洋群島は「裏南洋」、すなわち「表南洋」（東南アジア島嶼部）への進出拠点と位置づけられた。
sen.e: They were identified as 'Ura Nanyo', i.e., the Japanese base for advance into 'Omote Nanyo' (the islands in Southeast Asia).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: They were identified as 'Ura Nanyo', i.e., the Japanese base to advance into 'Omote Nanyo' (the islands in Southeast Asia).
sen.cmt: to advance into の方が自然です。
sen.e: They were identified as 'Ura Nanyo,' i.e., the Japanese base to advance into 'Omote Nanyo' (the islands in Southeast Asia).

sen.j: 一時的な南進ブームが高まった。
sen.e: Southward advancement became a fad.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Southward advancement became a fad.
Southward advancement became a fad.

sen.j: しかしこの時期の南進論の主流は貿易・投資・移民を軸に平和的な経済進出を唱道するものであった。
sen.e: However, mainstream Nanshinron during this period advocated peaceful economic advance, focusing on trade, investment and immigration.
However, mainstream Nanshinron during this period advocated peaceful economic advance, focusing on trade, investment and immigration.
However, mainstream Nanshinron during this period advocated peaceful economic advance, focusing on trade, investment and immigration.

tit.j: 昭和戦前期における南進論
tit.e: Nanshinron before World War II in the Showa Era
Nanshinron before World War II in the Showa Era
Nanshinron before World War II in the Showa Era

sen.j: 1930年代、満州事変以降、英米との関係が悪化して日本の国際的な孤立が進んだ。
sen.e: After the Manchurian Incident Japan was internationally isolated as her relationship with Britain and the United States worsened during the 1930s.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: After the Manchurian Incident Japan was internationally isolated as her relationship with Britain and the United States worsened during the 1930s.
After the Manchurian Incident Japan was internationally isolated as her relationship with Britain and the United States worsened during the 1930s.

sen.j: 「南進」はその後の国策の有力な選択肢の一つと考えられるようになった。
sen.e: 'Southward advance' was considered as one of the powerful options for Japan's prospective policy.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: 'Southward advance' was considered as one of the powerful options for Japan's prospective policy.
'Southward advance' was considered as one of the powerful options for Japan's prospective policy.

sen.j: 場合によっては武力を伴ってでも実施すべきものであるとされた。
sen.e: It was argued that it had to be carried out even with military force.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It was argued that it had to be carried out even with military force.
It was argued that it had to be carried out even with military force.

sen.j: しかし武力南進が実際に国策として決定されたのは1940年のことである。
sen.e: Yet it was only in 1940 that military advance into the south was determined as a national policy.
Yet it was only in 1940 that military advance into the south was determined as a national policy.
Yet it was only in 1940 that military advance into the south was determined as a national policy.

sen.j: この時日中戦争の泥沼に陥っていた日本。
sen.e: Japan was then dragged into the quagmire of the Sino-Japanese War.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Japan was then dragged into the quagmire of the Sino-Japanese War.
Japan was then dragged into the quagmire of the Sino-Japanese War.

sen.j: 1940年4月から6月のドイツの電撃戦により東南アジアに植民地を持つオランダ・フランスがドイツに降伏。
sen.e: The German blitzkrieg operations during April to June 1940 made the Netherlands and France that had colonies in Southeast Asia surrender to Germany.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The German blitzkrieg operations during April to June 1940 made the Netherlands and France that had colonies in Southeast Asia surrender to Germany.
The German blitzkrieg operations during April to June 1940 made the Netherlands and France that had colonies in Southeast Asia surrender to Germany.

sen.j: イギリスも危機に瀕していた。
sen.e: Britain was also endangered.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Britain was also endangered.
Britain was also endangered.

sen.j: このことを利用して東南アジアを自己の勢力を組み込めば危機的状況から脱出できると考えた。
sen.e: Taking advantage of this situation, Japan believed that it could get out of the critical situation if she could make Southeast Asia a part of the country
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Taking advantage of this situation, Japan believed that it could get out of the critical situation if she could make Southeast Asia a part of the country
Taking advantage of this situation, Japan believed that it could get out of the critical situation if she could make Southeast Asia a part of the country

sen.j: 武力南進を決意したのである。
sen.e: Thus, she decided on military advancement to the south.
Thus, she decided on military advancement to the south.
Thus, she decided on military advancement to the south.

sen.j: この武力南進は周到に準備された国策というよりは泥縄式に決められた政策であった。
sen.e: Rather than a carefully prepared national policy, this was a makeshift one.
Rather than a carefully prepared national policy, this was the one to makeshift.
sen.cmt: makeshiftをここで使う場合は、one to makeshift の方がいいかと思います。
sen.e: Rather than a carefully prepared national policy, this was the one to makeshift.

sen.j: 7月27日の大本営・政府連絡会議で、場合によれば武力を行使しても東南アジアに進出することが決められた。
sen.e: On July 27 the Imperial General Headquarters-Government Liaison Conference decided that Japan was to advance towards Southeast Asia, if necessary, with military force.
On July 27 the Imperial General Headquarters-Government Liaison Conference decided that Japan was to advance towards Southeast Asia, if necessary, with military force.
On July 27 the Imperial General Headquarters-Government Liaison Conference decided that Japan was to advance towards Southeast Asia, if necessary, with military force.

sen.j: 日本の武力南進の最初はフランス領インドシナ。
sen.e: Japan's first target was French Indochina.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Japan's first target was French Indochina.
Japan's first target was French Indochina.

sen.j: 当時のインドシナは中国国民政府（蒋介石政権）に対する英米の支援ルートになっていた。
sen.e: Indochina was then a support route of Britain and the United States to China under the Nationalist (Chiang Kai-sek) Government.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Indochina was then a support route of Britain and the United States to China under the Nationalist (Chiang Kai-sek) Government.
Indochina was then a support route of Britain and the United States to China under the Nationalist (Chiang Kai-sek) Government.

sen.j: 日本軍はフランスとの合意に基づき1940年9月この地に進駐した。
sen.e: In September 1940 the Japanese Imperial Navy advanced into Indochina according to an agreement with France.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In September 1940 the Japanese Imperial Navy advanced into Indochina according to an agreement with France.
In September 1940 the Japanese Imperial Navy advanced into Indochina according to an agreement with France.

sen.j: （北部仏印進駐）。
sen.e: (Advancement into the northern part of French Indochina).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: (Advancement into the northern part of French Indochina).
(Advancement into the northern part of French Indochina).

sen.j: 南進論を実行した結果、アメリカ合衆国によって石油の全面禁輸に踏み切られた。
sen.e: As a result, the United States banned the export of oil to Japan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: As a result, the United States banned the export of oil to Japan.
As a result, the United States banned the export of oil to Japan.

sen.j: 対米戦争に突入。
sen.e: Japan started a war with the United States.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Japan started a war with the United States.
Japan started a war with the United States.

sen.j: 最終的には敗戦する原因となった。
sen.e: Japan's advance into the south caused her to lose the war.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Japan's advance into the south caused her to lose the war.
Japan's advance into the south caused her to lose the war.

sen.j: 日本が南進で確保を目指した資源
sen.e: Target Resources in Japan's Advance into the South
